meanings.definition: To cut or tear off the limbs of (a person or animal)
meanings.sent1: The butcher was dismembering the chicken for cooking.
meanings.sent2: The serial killer was caught dismembering his victims.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef ended up dismembering the cake while trying to slice it.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to be dismembering the town as it tore through with destructive force.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's chisel skillfully worked at dismembering the block of marble into a beautiful statue.

meanings.definition: To divide into parts or pieces
meanings.sent1: The teacher was dismembering the lesson into smaller sections for better understanding.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle was dismembering my patience as I struggled to fit the pieces together.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was dismembering the tower of blocks with glee, scattering them all around.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes seemed to be dismembering the canvas, creating a masterpiece out of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The explosion dismembered the building, sending debris flying in all directions.
